Question: If you miss your exit on a motorway, you should:

Answers.Answer: use the flush median strip and reverse back to the exit
make a U-turn back to the exit
drive on to the next exit
slowly stop and reverse back to the exit

Question: If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you have a learner licence you can carry passengers if your supervisor is in the back seat.
What does the legal definition of a road include?
For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: What does this marking mean?
What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
This sign means the speed for safe and comfortable driving around the curve is 35km/h.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does it mean if yellow traffic signals are flashing?

Answers.Answer: That a crash has just happened
The traffic signals are not working, apply the give way rules
Vehicles may only proceed straight ahead and not turn
Emergency vehicles are about to come through

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

Answers.Answer: Only if there are vehicles in front of you
3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Question: What is the safest way to carry goods inside a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: On the floor by the driver’s feet
On the shelf near the rear window

Question: What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: Alcohol slows down your reactions when driving.
To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:
Can medication from your doctor affect your driving?
Flush medians can be used when:
What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible
